Class GameInputHandler

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.GameInputHandler
public class GameInputHandler extends Object
Handles keyboard input for the Tetris game.

This class processes key press events and translates them into game actions by delegating to the appropriate event listener methods. The handler respects game state, preventing input when the game is paused or over (except for pause and new game commands).

Supported Controls:

  • LEFT/A - Move piece left
  • RIGHT/D - Move piece right
  • UP/W - Rotate piece
  • DOWN/S - Soft drop (move down faster)
  • SPACE - Hard drop (instant drop)
  • P - Pause/unpause game
  • N - Start new game
  • C/SHIFT - Hold piece

    • handleKeyPress

      public void handleKeyPress(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Handles a key press event. Routes the key press to the appropriate game action based on the key code and current game state.
      Parameters:
      event - the KeyEvent to handle
